Hi

Occasionally we want to be able to restart the crawler and start a new
=
job and carry across the already-seen list, but nothing else (such as
the f=
rontier, up-time and url counters etc.)

My original idea for not carrying =
the frontier across was to recover
the crawl from a checkpoint, pause it, f=
lush the frontier and inject a
new set of seeds. There is no quick-and-easy=
 way to flush the
frontier, though. Dropping entries from the frontier base=
d on a regex
like ".*" is very time consuming (we have a frontier of 4.5m u=
rls).

Is there a simpler method for carrying the already-seen list between=

jobs without any other crawl data? Another option would be to extract
the =
appropriate bdb from the checkpoint and allow it to be
(de)serialised indep=
endently.

Our crawls are usually around 5 million urls, with around 6 GB o=
f bdb
files. We want to preserve the already-seen list for as long as
possi=
ble.
